Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: May_and_Mar_Lady
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location, just away from the hustle and bustle of central Paris but with a great selection of bars/restuarants opposite. Cour St-Emilion Metro station also just a stones throw away means you can get around and into the middle of Paris really easily. Bercy Village has a great selection of bars, the Frog at Bercy being one of them (although its very warm in there). Rooms are small, there is no denying it, but given that we didnt spend that much time in there it didnt bother us that much. The bed was a bit odd, a mattress on a plank of wood was literally what it was. That being said, we slept like logs after all the walking around Paris. Breakfast selection was more than adequate, cereals and pastry dishes aplenty. All the staff were very polite and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for paris”
Reviews.Author: Joshua711
Reviews.Content: 1. Very basic but clean room, bathroom and bed. Free wifi is great. English speaking staff is available. Reasonable price with early bird special sale. 2. Location is not exactly central. On the map it seems a little far from city center. However it is very close to metro. Also the metro station is line No.14! No.14 is vey clean and safe even iat night. Also, there are only just few stops (like express) you can go real central station "chatlet" (could transfer to many other lines) through just 3 stops! In addition there are some fabulous restaurant and cafe just in front of hotel (int the small street named bercy village before hotel) After all, location is not perfect but very right for sightseeing by metro. One drawback: because the hotel is very opposite side of Eiffel tower, it is a little difficult to come back after seeing the light show of Eiffel. 3. When I visited, the restaurant was under construction. Then in-room breakfast is poor. But as I know breakfast buffet before construction was just ok. 4. Some minor minus: luggage storage Is not for free/ there is no safe in the room (paris is famous for pickpocket)/ room is a little small (like most of paris hotel) but still we have space to open our big carrier.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Metro 14, a very quick transfer to central Paris, Gare de Lyon, Chatlet, Saint Lazard”
Reviews.Author: kat1
Reviews.Content: I booked one month ahead on ACCOR site, € 69.- non refundable - prepayment. Official rate is €92 in low season. From the map, I thought the hotel was 200metres from Cours Saint-Emillion metro stop. That's not far and ok. But when I actually walked between those 2 points, crossing Bercy village shopping/cafe, resto area, I felt like it was only half of it. Very short. The hotel is per IBIS standard, no surprise but when you know other IBIS, you might think this one is a bit better one. Newish/clean (although other IBIS I know have never been dirty either), staff perfectly fine, 2 free PC's at the lobby. Thanks to advices given here by other reviewers, I requested the highest floor possible on Bercy Village side so that you get a look of the Tour Eiffel and Pantheon although far. They gave me 7th floor and I was able to see the tour twinkles at night. The highest floor 8th was under renovation and was not available. We heard small noise occasionally (but never at night) not a real problem maybe because it was a weekend. As mentioned repeatedly by other reviewers, The shops and restos are open on Sunday at Bercy Village that's practical. Eat at one of the restos or if you wish, easy to buy a ready-to-eat sandwiches/salads at a Monoprix (Mono Shop?) along with a bottle of wine, etc that are found at their basement food area. Also many IBIS's have coin operated lockers that cost €3 - 4. This IBIS is one of them but at check-out when we needed to leave our bags until the evening, was told all the lockers were used and they were ready to keep the bags in their office. It was actually good as they were not charging for it. The newst Metro no.14 connects Bercy area/Bibliothèque Fraçois Metterand and St.Lazard station perhaps in less than 15 minutes (?). Not a very long line but also fewer stations so it's quite quick. Trains are automatically run, new and clean. Last month once I arrived at St.Lazard station from Rouen with a delay at 18h45 ( on time it would have been 18h10) and I had a connection to make, TGV from Gare de Lyon, departure at 19h11. Would I make it in 25 minutes? Seemed unlikely considering all the distances I needed to cover in between including trains stations and metro stations. I was almost ready to look for a hotel near the Gare de Lyon station and take the first TGV next day because 19h11 was the last TGV of the day for my last destination. Still I kept running (thanks to my light and small suitecase) and believe it or not I got on TGV19h11. Arrived at the platform 2 minutes before the departure ! Anyway I would stay at this IBIS again.

Reviews.Title: “definitely 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexinvancouver
Reviews.Content: staff at the front desk not friendly breakfast ok and located not far from metro station no coffeemaker and only two towels and way too expensive for service offered

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: ZeroC00L Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Some other guests made too much noise, not only in the night of 31DEZ, they were in 2 or 3 rooms. In one night - from 1 to 2 JAN - it was really a mess, knocking on other guests doors at 1:30AM, drinking, singing etc. But, I realize it´s not a hotel failure, nevertheless it was really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Metro and Restuarants at your doorstop, Paris Central 7mins”
Reviews.Author: keisand
Reviews.Content: It is true, location, restuarants, price, service, well appointed, friendly staff, why would you stay in the middle of the city when you can have space to breathe and the walking distance is better or the same. Our room was a bit small, but from what we saw, we drew the short straw which is invevitable at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Irishcurls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I always stay in Bercy village when we visit Paris as it's a fantastic location, beautiful cobbled streets with plenty of lively restaurants & bars year round, and right on one of the city's best metro lines only a few stops away from the centre (metro comes every 3 minutes!) We usually stay in the Pullman hotel but couldn't justify spending the €200 a night rate over New Year's Eve so opted for the Ibis instead. Having never stayed in an Ibis before we were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness of the rooms, the ease of checking in/out, and the helpfulness of staff. The rooms are very small and basic (no luxuries here!) but fine, a great base for visiting Paris when all you really need is a clean place to rest your head. At €75 a night the rate was considerably cheaper than our usual hotel and we'll probably stay there again the next time we visit Paris. The only small problems we encountered were when housekeeping tried to come in and clean our room while the Do not Disturb was on the door - which was a worry for privacy. Also, the doors are very thin, so if you are suffering jetlag or want a daytime nap, you will hear every footstep, door slam, hoover etc - the same goes for early nights and late mornings. Be warned if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs. Another small tip is, if you plan to store luggage there on the day of your departure, the luggage lockers are located on the 1st floor, at €2 for a small locker and €4 for a big one for 24hrs. The small lockers aren't large enough to fit an average check-in case and the big lockers are in short supply, so get up early to avoid missing out and having to drag your luggage around with you all day! Overall this suited us perfectly for our trip to Paris, for us the location is the biggest winner, but it's also great value so you can spend the money you save enjoying Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only minutes from the newest Metro (line 14) and then just 7 or 8 minutes to the very heart of Paris. However the very lively Bercy Village with it's restaurants and shops is even closer that the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Bercy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location ( 14 line Metro ) and excellent area of Paris ( Bercy ). Easy connecting from Aeroport CDG , RER B (CDG -> Chatelet - Les Halles) and Metro 14 ( Chatelet -> Cour St. Emilion ) . In Bercy Village are several cafes ,cinema and park. ... ~ 300-400m from Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: JohnPhilipD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times in this hotel. I choose it because it is a good price (for Paris), is convenient for the office I visit (just outside Paris on East) and has good bars and restaurants nearby. If you want to get into the heart of Paris there is a Metro station very close and also one at Bercy (different line) less than 10 minutes walk. The hotel is also one of the better of the Ibis branded hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: kate186470
Reviews.Content: Bercy village is a lovely area with restaurants and shops. The metro is so convenient for quick access to the sights. The staff at the hotel were really helpful and pleasant. The room was small but clean and had everything you could want.It was great value and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Bercy Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Subtrotter
Reviews.Content: I know what to expect from Ibis, basic value rooms, I guess this is what I received and for €89 its probbaly OK value. Tiny room, just enough space to walk past the end of the bed, and a shower room. Temperature was hot so the windows were flung open but as you would expect traffic noise was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Except for a faily unwelcomming attitude by the guy in the reception at our arrival, the hotel met our expectations. We have family close by, and only need a quiet and clean room with at comfortable bed, and these demands were met perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms in a nice area and surprisingly large rooms for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveller21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a wedding party and was pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms and the area itself. I expected to be on the outskirts but the hotel is bang smack in the middle of a really nice area with a village feel and plenty of pubs and bistros to choose from (with Parisian prices though it must be said). You are three very speedy Metro stops from the centre (Chatelet, Les Halles, Hotel De Ville) and the area is very safe to return to at night. I know that nobody books an Ibis for luxury but the room and bathroom size are above average for Paris and it was absolutely spotless. This is more than I can say for alot of hotels I've stayed in in Paris so I would definitely return. The air con isnt great which was difficult in August with Parisian heat but all in all I was very pleased. My only complaint is the luggage lockers. Everybody flies out of Paris late and wants to have a final look around after checking out. In the Ibis this will cost you a fortune in luggage lockers. The instructions on the doors are written in Frenglish and are WRONG. Each one costs a non refundable 4euro so you really don't want the few attempts it take to trying to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChickaGir Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean with a large shower/toilet room. Could just make out the tip of the Eiffel tower from our room. No kettle or fridge in the room and could get a bit stuffy throughout the night. Area is fairly quiet with many restaurants and cafes and a Monoprix store down the road. Metro station is across from the Bercy village cafe strip but the hotel is located closer to the outer edges of Paris, hence the lower price. Taxi ride from Gare du Nord cost us about 18 euros (with tip).

Reviews.Title: “Better than other Ibis I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: zpherr
Reviews.Content: This ibis is quite new and the room (esp the toilet) is also more spacious than other Ibis. 1 minute walk from the metro. It is located right next to the Bercy Village where you can find a number of nice restaurants and a supermarket (BTW, Bercy Village is not that exciting at all). But not much to see around the area but it is okay. The staff was in general nice and helpful. I definitely will stay there again given its reasonable rate compared to other hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Gamil180 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location , i asked for room with eiffel tower view .it was nace view specially when you saw the tower at night. Also there is carrfour market one bus station from the hotel.the room was very small but suffeciant. The bercy garden was charming.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor services”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia0972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location just in front of the Bercy Village, on the opposite river side of the National Library, very well connected via public transportation. It is ideal for visiting Paris and for shopping. However, the structure is pretty old, the rooms are not very clean, very small and without basic comfort (not even a frigo bar). The toilets accessories are very old and not clean. Because you don't have the frigo bar in the room, there are 2 automatic distributors (soft drinks and snacks) in from of the lifts on the ground floor. However, during my staying they were both out of order. The restaurant was closed for restructuring. Fortunately the staff is very friendly. In my opinion, the price of the room, 128 Euro without breakfast, is too high for the service you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Excellent Rates, Pro Staff”
Reviews.Author: PucksterColorado
Reviews.Content: This budget-friendly hotel has a lot to offer. Staff excellent and very pro. Plenty of English speakers on staff. Quickly helped us make some awkward arrangements as well as medical care for one in our group. The location is very near metro stop and across the street from Bercy Village, which is SO cool... restaurants, shops, incredible park. You could easily enjoy a weekend just in the 4-block area here. Since hotel caters to business people, they're currently offering weekend rates of only 100 euros/night. Very clean rooms, updated and modern. Small, but beds are comfy. Breakfast was fine. This is a terrific corner of Paris where tourists don't rule while the Parisian experience is right out your door. Love this little find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ranga27
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, awesome neighbourhood. Bercy village is one of the hidden gems of Paris. Though rooms are quite small, worth the value owing to the area. Metro station is 3 mins walk and City centre is 15 mins by metro 14. Only complain was most of the breakfast got over before 9:30 (officially till 10) and nobody bothered to refill.

Reviews.Title: “Good utilities and location, but poor services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice community. Also, it's just a few mins walk to the metro station. The hotel provided with good utility and security. without a keycard, u cannot use the lift. They provide lockers for baggage storage. It could be a good choice. Yet, some of the staff are really rude.

Reviews.Title: “great Location for an evening out and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: russellh731
Reviews.Content: There is a very good reataraunt and bar scene close to this hotel also very close to the Metro station rooms are comfortable and quiet

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: budget hotel in paris; located in bercy quartier not very close to downtown, bur well served with new underground line # 14 (9 station, linked with other 10 underground lines and with all the 5 lines of the RER). breakfast is on average. rooms size on average. staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable clean hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: regtraveller24 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not very central, but it is in a nice, safe area and is very close to the Metro station. It is clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay here again, and I would suggest this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Parigi ibis bercy village”
Reviews.Author: otmargeiss
Reviews.Content: Simple and clean. Close to restaurants and shops. Close to metro station. 15 mins to turistic centre by metro. During my stay restaurant was unavailable and breakfast was served in the room. The bercy village is an agglomeration of shops and restaurants. If you do not want to go back to the centre for dinner, there are plenty of restaurants in the bercy village.

Reviews.Title: “Jet lagged in Ibis Bercy Village”
Reviews.Author: lwk-my Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Paris heavily jet lagged. Checked in to the hotel and one of the first things we did was sleep off our jet lag. Fortunately sleep quality was good and we managed a 15- hour sleep session. The hotel's location was convenient due to the close proximity of the metro. Getting around Paris was a breeze. We tried the hotel's breakfast and it was satisfactory for the price (€8). I will most likely stay at this hotel if I visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum, another Ibis Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Policypeddler Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I knew what I was getting.....boring and no frills. For that reason, the hotel is no surprise. I wish they would fix the card reader in the West elevator. I continually had trouble with it and frequently had trouble with the room recognizing my card. Front desk frequently "refreshed" the card but the elevator just didn't work correctly (many others on elevator had same problem)

Reviews.Title: “What else?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What else..?? My rate already talks for me!! The service, the cleanliness and the rooms were very good... The hotel is located in a so nice palce..near the quite Bercy Village... And I had a so nice trip...;)

Reviews.Title: “My choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HernanCortez
Reviews.Content: I stay at IBIS hotels many times a year while travelling for work. I like them because they are usually good value and have rarely been disappointed. I know what to expect and I usually get it. I've stayed in 7 or 8 other IBIS hotels in Paris and the IBIS Bercy Village is my favourite. Whenever I go to Paris for work for a period of less than 1 week, I now stay there. The location is great, right next to Bercy Village with its shops, restaurants and cinemas. There is now a large Monoprix there as well. It's only 2 minutes walk to the newest metro line in Paris which gets you to Chatelet in about 7 minutes. The metro station is Cour St Emillon. The area is quiet, there's a nice park and a couple of velib stations. For me it's the best option. Warning .... don't get Bercy and Bercy Village mixed up !!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Frog and Bercy Village brew pub”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern in a modern part of Paris a very short walk from the metro and very easy to get to. The room was spartan as is usual with Ibis but the room and bathroom were very clean and the bead was comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed and pillow”
Reviews.Author: steveqae
Reviews.Content: Never seen a bed like this before, it was a sheet of chipboard on legs with a thin mattress on the top, also the pillows were hard. The advertised airconditioning was not working and I was told it had been turned off as the summer season was over.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs - stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: BR0wNTr0UT
Reviews.Content: If you like sleeping on a hard bed that creaks every move you make then you'll love this place. The base was made of a single piece of plywood?!?!?!? The food is lousy and the service terrible, walk accross the road to the village, even if its raining. Yes it's basic and reasonably clean but when you're away from home you need to relax and sleep well, this is not possible here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly clean, by a great Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: Annisherm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriends for 4 nights over New Year's. The room was very small but spotless. The bed was quite comfortable. As people have said, it's a 2 minute walk to a great Metro stop that either goes directly to places of interest or easily connects to other lines. This was a fantastic feature. It's right in Bercy Village, which is really just a strip of a few shops and restaurants. The area itself wasn't particularly exciting, especially for 21 year olds, but it was convenient to have restaurants right there after a long day of travel. For other young people, especially women- this area isn't close to anything too cool, but it is very safe. Splurge on a cab home a few nights from a fun area and come home to a safe, nice hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sharonkitty72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2009. Was on my own so the room was a good size although if I had not been travelling alone it may have been a bit cramped. Nice decor, clean room and comfy bed. Didnt spend that much time at hotel as was mainly around the POPB area seeing friends as was there for an event. Staff were pretty friendly and liked the fact you could 1> Smoke in the room and 2> Order snacks 24/7. I was in Paris for a total of 4 nights and booked this hotel as I couldnt get into the All Seasons Bercy nearer to the arena. I did stay at the All Seasons the last night of my stay (All pre booked before I left) and wished I hadnt!! Another review for that... Cant comment on the food as never ate there but do think it's time they updated the bar/restaurant area as I did have a drink there 5 years ago and it doesnt seem to have changed at all!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and tidy Rooms, Convieniently placed, Fabulous Breakfast - Very Expensive Parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: phil3946
Reviews.Content: First things first - we arrived and parked the car - couldn't believe the price at 28 euro for 24hrs. Thought that it would be 28 euro in total for the 2 nights because it only gave the option of 2hrs, 4hrs or 24hrs but no it cost 56 euros for 2 nights. To top it off the machine wouldn't accept any of our UK m/c or visa credit cards! Check in was quick and the staff spoke a variety of languages and the languages that they spoke were indicated on their name tags. The rooms were clean and tidy - we had a twin room, the en-suite was as you would expect - with the toilet and shower in. The TV was fine - didn't go to Paris to watch TV so for a quick news update it was fine. We stayed for the 2 nights and were pleasantly suprised to have fresh towels etc the second day. The breakfast (although 7 - 8 euros) was well worth it in comparison to prices everywhere else. They had pretty much everything you would need and was well presented - very impressed! The location was great with plenty of restuarants near by, the underground only a short distance away. There was even a good sized park nearby which was great for a walk. There were shops and supermarkets nearby too which gives you an option to buy food and have a picnic. Anyway - overall we were satisfied with the accomodation. Things were expensive (about 7 euros on average for a lager!) but it is Paris. We would recommend to friends but would suggest looking for cheaper parking because with that on top it almost was the cost of another night. If there isn't any cheaper parking then i wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Xstar
Reviews.Content: Good location for a medium rate hotel in Paris. As other reviewers have said - close to Cour St Emilion metro station for fast travel into central Paris while at the same time in a relatively tranquil setting close to Parc Bercy and the chic Bercy Village shops and restaurants. For gardening enthusiasts, I recommend a look at the very imaginative planting and layout of the park. Take a stroll through the park and turn left to be within easy reach of Pont Tolbiac and the river. Room on the small side but what do you expect at this price in Paris and I was fortunate to have a view from the 8th right over to the Eiffel Tower way in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: LePope
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the IBIS Bercy Village. This hotel is ideally located, just at the footstep of Bercy Village with restaurants and a wonderful park. Across the street from the superfast Métro ligne 14 which brings you in less than 10 minutes to Chatelet - Les halles station (a train every 2:30 mins !). Just outside the hotel, you also find a Vélib' bike station. For those arriving from A4 motorway, you don't even have to enter the Périph': the hotel is just a few hundred meters from the end of the motorway. Rooms are small (but as everywhere in Paris), but recently furnished (with flat TV) and clean. Staff is very friendly both at the reception and for breakfast. On top, you can get some very good deals on the web (as low as 49€/night in July/August). I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a quick stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mervin_75
Reviews.Content: Looking for a nice standard Hotel in Paris for two nights stay, I can't say that I've not been satisfied - The environment of this Ibis is really nice, the "village" surrounding it is really cool and all pubs, restaurants around are nice. The rooms were clean and my stay was comfortable. Service was fair (I didn't ask for anything neither) but okay... They were helpful but remain Parisians (ok, tell you what you want, finish). About the noise...well, I didn't hear anything - Had drinks a a nice English Pub down the hotel (The Frog at Bercy Village) before going to bed, it helps to sleep well, lol I would recommend this place to people who look for a nice place, fair price in Paris

Reviews.Title: “To Expensive”
Reviews.Author: PeterboroughSqueek
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great — just minutes from the Metro, via the old wine storage warehouses which have been restored and are now bars/cafes and restrauants — wonderful for watching the world go by! Reception, hotel bar and 'eating area' were fine, all the tables being the 'three feet' type, so no rocking and spilt beer here! Rooms were very sparse, and this is the main reason for not staying at Ibis hotels in future. This is the second Ibis( Dinant /Belgium) and the furnishings was the same, so obviously this hotel chain 'buys in bulk', and do not furnish country by country. Only TWO warn out towels, hardly enough to wash your hands! - a small shower mat with one measly little bottle of shower soap, and even that was not added too on second nights stay! - Oh, and the toilet paper was worse than cheap! — Be careful or take your own! The bed, felt like a straw filled mattress but was quite comfortable, but the pillows felt as though they were full of rolled up newspaper! — There is no carpet, one 'trash receptacle' and that was in the shower room. The television, wall mounted, was a very cheap model, the picture was awful and think an engineer would not go amiss! - with only one programme in english, BBC World News, no internet facilities. Storage space was a joke, a floor to ceiling bookcase 'thing' with one side with no shelfs, enough room to hang a couple of coats! — No 'welcome' literature/general tourist information on the the fixed wall mounted table, no tea facilities, and the emergency procedure / fire exits information was missing! - you had to store your suitcase under 'the table' thing! It was not the time of year to use the air conditioning, but apparently it did not function in the next room! Breakfast was NOT included, a bad point, considering the cost per night (110 euro), you had to purchase tickets from reception (8 euro). Breakfast was a bit grim, very basic continental, a basket of hard boiled eggs and a better selection of meats/cheese (there was only one of each) would have been welcome, not worth the eight euros! To store your luggage on checkout until travel time, lockers were provided on the first floor, which cost four euro, thats a new one on me! - usually this is a free service. This hotel was fine as a quick overnight stay, in late, out early, but thats about it - the price and facitities just did not match. We shall not use Ibis again in any country, it will be worth the extra cost to have the luxury of a hand towel and shower gel at a Holiday Inn. 'Nicht gut'

Reviews.Title: “A great location, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Millylilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely place to stay, especially in the spring and summer months when the weather is good. Bercy Village is a pedestrianised area, converted from old wine storage buildings, with the old cobbled streets and artwork displayed in the walkways. We really appreciated being out of the madness of Montmatre or the other main tourist areas, as there wa sno traffic noise at all, and lots of places to shop,eat and drink on the doorstep. The hotel room was small but well designed and spotlessly clean with lots of storage space. Breakfast was typical French fayre, but delicious. There are lots of cafes, restaurants and bars within 5 mins walk, and the Metro at Bercy. We had a great time just lounging at the pavement cafes and bars people watching. The hotel is also near to some good shopping. I will admit that we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, just sleeping really, but it was perfectly adequate for our needs, and the staff spoke English and Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: NBGirlTraveller
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 9 nights at this hotel and we highly recommend it. When you look at it on a map it looks to be way outside the city center, but everything you will need is close by, and the best, newest metro line in the city stops one block over. It takes about 5 minutes to get to the 1e arrondissement! If you don't want to take the metro, then you will likely find this hotel to be too far away for your needs. The metro goes about every three minutes from the stop nearest the hotel on weekdays and maybe 4 or 5 on the weekends. They go from about 5:30 am to 12:30am so it is very convenient. The hotel is new, clean, air-conditioned, and well-kept. The street it's on is quiet. The rooms are plenty big enough (but nowhere to take out your clothes really) and the beds were comfy. In some rooms you can see the Eiffel Tower. I can't comment on the staff's ability to speak English as we were both fluent in French, but we found them helpful. The internet and phone are paying (a lot!) as they are everywhere over there. If you want something that has "personality" or "looks like Paris" this is not it, it is a chain hotel. The breakfast buffet is good, and a great value at 8 euros, lots to eat and you won't find a better deal elsewhere if you like to start the day with a big breakfast. We asked for no tickets and then just paid right there on the days we wanted to go and eat the buffet. There also is a court just next door with a number of stores and restaurants called "Bercy village" and a grocery store just down the street as well. We would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaO14
Reviews.Content: Room clean, bed comfortable, water hot, what more can you ask? Breakfast could have been better, pancakes were cold!

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming!”
Reviews.Author: popdesign
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my stay at Ibis Bercy Village. I stayed at a room at the 7th floor, that has the old ibis decoration (the new ones it's only until the 5th floor), but I didn't want to change because the room has a bathtub and the new ibis appartments have only a shower! The rooms are very clean and the staff very sympa ;-) The room size is ok, not so big like other countries, but I think that it's very nice if you travel on a budget. They have all the necessary stuff for a good vacation at Paris. The breakfast is very nice and it was 7,50 euros, a nice price for all the stuff like breads, chocolate, coffee, juice, cakes, yogurt, etc... and I enjoyed the decoration of the restaurant about cyclism. I ate dinner at the restaurant (6 jours the name) and it was nice too. And the location was very cool. The hotel is very close to Bercy Village, a open air place with restaurants and stores and very close to the station Cour St-Emilion of the line 14, the newest line from Paris that connects at almost all the stations with other important lines. So going to the main part of the city wasn't a hard task.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: QueenRabbit
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this a long time after I stayed here. But I now live in Paris, and I have to say, now that I know Paris so well, if I were to recommend a hotel to someone coming to Paris for the first time, it would be this one. Particularly for the location, but also because the hotel is very comfortable and the staff are so lovely. Maybe they've changed since, I don't know, but the hotels rooms won't have changed much - they're good ibis standard. Plenty of hot water, a bath, sizable rooms and comfortable beds. I often go to Bercy village for its gorgeous, cute atmosphere. There are some lovely shops, and restaurants, and it makes for a perfect romantic setting. It is safe, friendly, and right on the metro line to get to anywhere you want in Paris - line number 14. It's not near the Moulin Rouge, as one recent reviewer suggested - they must have got it mixed up with ibis montmartre. Here, you're with real french people, not so many tourists, and the hotel in IN Bercy village, not next to it. It's actually a few doors closer than the Sofitel. I don't see the point in paying so much more when you're getting practically the same deal (sofitel are own by the same chain of hotels as ibis, and although the beds might not be so chic, and you don't get the same design, they maintain the same good standards of service), and I say that as someone who loves luxury, and often stays in five star hotels. But I don't spend stupidly, and I'm not a snob - if the hotel next door boasts the same location, and is warm, inviting and comfortable, and is half the price, I don't see any reason to pay the extra. Ibis is a respected mark of the same chain of hotels as sofitel. It's not dingy or dirty. The centre of paris can be dodgy at night (especially the champs elysess and pigalle). And, often restaurants, and shops close early. This place is so safe and warm and beautiful, and it's buzzing and lit up until 2am every night. It's a place to come home to and relax after a hard days' sightseeing. The perfect retreat. I would definately recommend the area for a first trip to Paris. And you cant' beat the Ibis here for value. I'm surprised it's so cheap, being in such a lovely area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable hotel, in a "village atmosphere" ... in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Tadzio76
Reviews.Content: It's not the usual Ibis Hotel we're used to. I liked the modern and clean decoration of the bedrooms as well as the neighborhood. Price: I had my bedroom at 50 euros - don't really remember why, but it was booked quite in advance for a sunday night - I had to catch a train at Gare de Lyon ... this hotel is very convnient to avoid the messy surroundings of big train stations ... The location: Bercy village is a former place where wines were stocked. Now it's a beautful street for pedestrians where you find lots of shops and restaurants. It is also near Bercy Gardens, the POPB ( concert hall ) and some cinemas ... It is next to the seine and the Big Library Mitterand. Note: they do breakfast starting at 4.30 AM ! BEN.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: pixfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the last week of June, 2007. Since the airshow was going on in Paris and all other rooms were booked, this was really my only choice. Pros: Clean, Comfortable and Quiet Rooms were of typical size Hot Shower A/C Very close to Bercy Village - a nice collection of shops, restaurants, and stores. Near superfast #14 metro line - gets you into the city in about 5-8 minutes. Metro is Coeur St Emilion Near a wonderful park Price is right Breakfast was pretty good The staff was wonderfully polite and went out of their way to be helpful I felt safe in the area Not too big, not too small. I think there were about 200 rooms. Cons: It's a modern hotel - not what you go to Paris for Location is not within walking distance of typical Parisian attractions No room safe Other comments: It's a nice hotel with quick access into the center of Paris. However, it lacks any type of Parisian "flavor" at all. It's an inexpensive business hotel. This would not be a terrible choice if you could not find a hotel in the center of Paris. It has very basic accomodations - no frills at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gem1987
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in this hotel after leaving an awful hotel named 'Hotel Moderne Montmartre', which was just up the road. We foud the Ibis hotel and decided to stay there immediatley! It was clean, well deorated and at a reasonable price. It was very much like a travel lodge type hotel. It was ideally located in the heart of Paris, just up the road from the Moulin Rouge! It was a bit of a hike to get to access the main attractions such as l'arch de triomphe and the eiffel tower but the local transport was very wide. The metro station was just a couple of blocks away and it gave us easy access to Disneyland Paris. Overall, I would say that the hotel was a very nice and comfortable place to say and ideal to make your stay a very welcome one.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucked”
Reviews.Author: Davidinbc
Reviews.Content: What a night. We had to beg the staff for pillows, soap, bedding, etc. The worst part was that it was 35C outside and 34C inside. The staff was in kaos due to all the problems that people were experiencing with the Hotel. There was great shopping nearby, but that can be said for almost any hotel in this great city. Also it should be noted that the directions they provide for getting to this hotel were a bit confusing. We have stayed in a lot of Ibis Hotels and this is the first and only time that we have experienced problems with one. It might have been bad luck on our part, that our visit turned out this way. We only stayed one night and then moved on to St Paul-leMarais near the Bastille, which was exceptional. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Paris, Bercy.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The IBIS at Bercy is a clean, well situated and affordable hotel just next to Bercy Village. It is simply a place to stay whilst enjoying Paris so don’t expect lots of extras, but it is an ideal choice for people wanting a room as a base while they spend their days exploring Paris. It has a restaurant downstairs that provides meals and drinks throughout the day. I would recommend the IBIS as it is well placed and affordable. Bercy itself contains all that you could need while you are away.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Paris Bercy Village
HotelInfo.Address: 19, Place des Vins de France | 12th Arr., 75012 Paris, France
